3. A little bleeding of the gums after brushing or flossing is normal.
4. Aspirin placed next to a tooth is a good way to relieve a toothache.
5. Baby teeth don’t need to be brushed because they fall out in a few years.
6. If I’m not having any pain in my mouth, there’s no need to see a dentist.
7. How often should you change your toothbrush?
8. Which amount of toothpaste is appropriate? Select the picture below:
9. How many teeth do children have in primary dentition? Please fill in a number:
When was the last time you saw your dentist? Take care of yourself!
Wow! Your dentist should be proud to have you!

* Don`t forget to brush your teeth with a fluoridated toothpaste two times a day. 
* Spaces between your teeth should be cleaned with a dental floss and interdental brushes. 
* Use a special one tooth brush for places which are hard to reach. 
* Have a healthy diet and see your dentist two times per year unless your doctor told you otherwise.
